title: Pink wows fans as she soars through the air in bejeweled bodysuit
text:
She's famous for her gravity-defying live aerial performances in addition to her rocking repertoire of hit pop songs.

And Pink did not disappoint on Saturday in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, where she performed during day 6 of the Rock In Rio Music Festival at Cidade do Rock within the Parque Olimpico.

The Don't Let Me Get Me singer, 40, rocked a shock of punky peroxide blond hair and dazzled in a sparkly leotard, at one point literally hanging upside down as she was suspended over the concert crowds.

Flying high: Pink did not disappoint on Saturday in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, where she performed during day 6 of the Rock In Rio Music Festival at Cidade do Rock

Pink, whose real name is Alecia Beth Moore, complemented her bejeweled one-piece with glittering fishnets, and wore black leather calf-height boots with high platform feels.

At one point the mother of two draped herself in a black sheer jacket.

The concert on Saturday night was the second-to-last concert of her Beautiful Trauma World Tour.

The tour began at the Talking Stick Resort Arena in Phoenix, Arizona bach in March 2018, and it will conclude on November 2 of this year at the Circuit Of The Americas in Austin, Texas.

Musical moment: The Don't Let Me Get Me singer rocked a shock of punky peroxide blond hair and dazzled in a sparkly leotard at the show

In the intervening time, the concert tour has whisked Pink around Europe as well as through Australia and New Zealand.

Earlier in the week, she was spotted greeting a throng of delighted fans in the Brazilian metropolis.

Her North American concerts have included a slew of gigs in both the United States and Canada, but the excitement was palpable this week in Rio as her only South American tour date was Saturday's show there.

Soaring: At one point, Pink, who is famous for her aerial concert stunts, was literally hanging upside down over the crowds

Free as a bird: Pink complemented her bejeweled one-piece with glittering fishnets, and wore black leather calf-height boots with high platform feels

The Raise Your Glass performer took to Instagram to share the love for her Brazilian fans, posting a photo and video from the evening's festivities.

She captioned the image, which depicted her atop a giant chandelier high up over the stage, as follows: 'That’s me up top, 100,000 strong tonight. My heart is so full Rio. Thank you for having this lady as your headliner this year. I’ve been waiting to meet you all for a long long time. I love y’all. ❤️❤️ #rocknrio'

The tour, Pink's seventh, is meant to plug her 2017 album of the same name, which also happened to be her seventh studio album.

Pink has been married to off-road truck racer Carey Hart since 2006 and they have two children — Willow, eight, and Jameson, two.
